title: CBC Life
text:
You need the right tools if you want to do the job properly. So what do you need if "the job" is win a ceremonial cake plate and get crowned Canada's best home baker? Great question. We asked the bakers of The Great Canadian Baking Show Season 3 for the one kitchen tool they can't live without.

Liam

I can't live without a spatula and food processor. It just makes life so much easier.

Mary Lou

The one kitchen tool I cannot live without is probably my mixer. It's big and it makes everything that I want.

If there's one thing this GCBS bakers love, it's a stand mixer. (The Great Canadian Baking Show)

Andrea

The one kitchen tool I can't live without is my mixer. I love my mixer so much, I actually have two of them. I have my big red and my baby grey.

Jodi

The one kitchen tool I can't live without is my wooden spoon. And also my whisk.

Colin

I can't live without a French-tipped rolling pin. I feel like I have more control with it, and I like that it's French. It sounds fancy.

Never underestimate the value of a good spatula. (Getty Images/iStockphoto)

Betty

I think they call it a bench scraper? I used it all the time.

Jay

The one kitchen tool I can't really live without would be my stand mixer. Sometimes when I'm making batters and doughs I double them, and it's hard to do by hand. I'm kind of big and strong, but after a while, your arm still gets tired, so that's when a stand mixer really comes in handy.

Chris

I can't live without my trusty spatula. I use that thing for everything.

Is it fancier than a regular rolling pin? Well it has French right in the name, so... (Getty Images)

Nataliia

My stand mixer is the kitchen tool I can't live without.

Jasmine

The one kitchen tool I can't live without is a really good rubber spatula. One that's got a connected body to the top rubber part. If it comes apart when you're baking, that's just a mess, so that's something that it's really important for me to have.
description: What’s better than a stand mixer? Two stand mixers
